ygData.subject: RE: Hunting wisps
ygData.msgSnippet: West Commonlands is indeed much more populated with wisps.  Try to get SOW from someone - offer a druid or shaman a few gold and say that you will come to
ygData.messageBody:
West Commonlands is indeed much more populated with wisps. Try to get SOW
from someone - offer a druid or shaman a few gold and say that you will
come to them, or try and find one and ask while you are there... If you
stay between the trail and the inn (directly west of where the trail is),
Giants will rarely bother you. Kizdean Gix is mean, but never bothered my
monk... I usually roam around the hills surrounding the inn, and stay
close enough to the zone to make a run... Other than than, bind yourself
to Qeynos and take the boat to Wisp (Kerra) Isle... Find out where the
wisps spawn and camp there with a few other people... Good exp through
level 15 and excellent money...

Jason

-----Original Message-----
From: %systemroot% [SMTP:tschultz1@...]
Sent: Tuesday, August 24, 1999 11:11 AM
To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
Subject: [EQ-Monks] Hunting wisps

From: "%systemroot%" <tschultz1@...>

First post to this list, woo.

I'm 11th lvl on the Prexus server, and just recently obtained woven gloves.
Since I can now actually hit them, I've been searching for wisps in E
Commonlands and finding maybe one per hour of real time (!). Now, I know
it's a busy zone and that their heavily hunted there -- is there perhaps a
better place to find them? I've been avoiding W Commons due to the
likelihood of being crushed by hill giants and/or smacked around by the
griffs, not to mention double-teamed by young kodiaks...

Thanks in advance,

Tobe

Pragma, 11th Order servant of Quellious
